10.26.text: I’ve just come out of the most wonderful two and a half hours in the Sam Wannamaker Playhouse.

15.86.text: If you haven’t been there, do rush to get to it.

21.02.text: It was unexpectedly delightful. The theatre is like a jewel.

27.74.text: It made it timeless in a way, hearing new poetry and old poetry,

33.28.text: and yet being in such a historical but new playhouse it really made a big difference to the experience and

38.30.text: I don’t think it’d be the same being anywhere else.

42.88.text: You got a real sense of how deeply engaged the musician was with the music.

46.56.text: You could see his expressions changing.

49.96.text: It was a really good experience hearing new poetry fresh on the night

52.84.text: night that nobody had heard before.

54.18.text: I thought that was really exciting.

58.06.text: I love the little touches of gold and the luminosity

61.52.text: It really gives you a proper historical frisson to be inside.

68.76.text: It’s like being in another century.

70.84.text: I’ve never been in another space quite like it.
